scopecontent.p: This collection consists of a student notebook kept by Ralph B. Thompson which contains excerpts translated into English from Paul Karrer's "Lehrbuch der organischen chemie" and notes to Chemistry 17A by Paul D. Bartlett. Pages 1-66 contain translated sections from Karrer's text. Thompson began this translation as a means to improve his German. The remainder of the notebook is taken up with notes from a course Thompson took with Paul D. Bartlett at Harvard. Bartlett's renowned course on organic reaction mechanisms was the first to emphasize mechanism over memorization, a radically innovative approach that transformed the teaching of organic chemistry worldwide.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
